creator.name: Gemeentebestuur van Suriname
creator.his_func:
The Government Regulations of 1828 foresaw the establishment of a municipal government. It was responsible for the administration of local affairs, such as the determination of the civil registration. The supervisors of the various districts in Paramaribo fell under the authority of this municipal government. For the collection of local taxes, such as the share of sugar plantations or timberland, there was a local tax collector. Instruments of conveyance and mortgage had to be executed before this municipal council.
This local government consisted of the following twelve members: a president, two aldermen (wethouders), eight councillors and a secretary.
No mention was made of a municipal government in the new Government Regulations of 1832. Therefore, it functioned until January, 1, 1833.
